title: American_Top_40_1974_December_14th
description:
"This is Casey Kasem with American Top 40 and the countdown doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t stop till we get to number one."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

A listener asks, "What number one song took the longest number of weeks to reach the top spot?"

This chart sets a record by being first time all four members of a former band (the Beatles) are in the top 40 as solo acts.

One artist in the countdown begged and pleaded with the record company for months before they released his first single. He didn't want him to.	Casey tells the story.

Casey explains how Bachman-Turner Overdrive got the word "Overdrive" in the band's name.

One record in the countdown moves up a big 27 spots. It didn't reach number one until 1975 but it was the only Beatles cover song to do so.
